Module logsweet.net¶

This module contains functionality for transporting log messages over the network.

class logsweet.net.Broadcaster(bind_address: str, ctx: Optional[zmq.sugar.context.Context] = None)[source]¶

A text line broadcaster.

Parameters:
  • bind_address (str) – An IP and port to bind the ZeroMQ socket to. E.g. 127.0.0.1:9001
  • ctx (Optional[zmq.Context]) – An existing ZeroMQ context to use for the IO work. If None uses the default singleton instance.
send(topic: str, line: str)[source]¶

Broadcasts the given text line.

Parameters:
  • topic (str) – The topic association of the text line.
  • line (str) – The text line.
class logsweet.net.Listener(addresses: Sequence[str], handler: Union[Callable[[str, str, str], None], Any], watch_cb: Optional[Callable[[str, str], None]] = None, unwatch_cb: Optional[Callable[[str, str], None]] = None, interval: float = 0.1, ctx: Optional[zmq.sugar.context.Context] = None)[source]¶

Subscribes to one or more ZeroMQ PUB sockets and listens to broadcasted log messages; passing log messages to a callback.

Parameters:
  • addresses (Sequence[str]) – A sequence of addresses to connect to. E.g. ["127.0.0.1:9001", "192.168.10.20:9001"]
  • handler (Union[Callable[[str, str, str], None], Any]) –

    A function which is called every time a log message is received; this is called with source, filename, and line arguments.

    Alternatively an object with a method notify_line(source, filename, line) and optionally the methods notify_watch(source, filename) and notify_unwatch(source, filename).

  • watch_cb (Optional[Callable[[str, str], None]]) – A function which is called every time a file has joined the set of watched files; this is called with a filename argument.
  • unwatch_cb (Optional[Callable[[str, str], None]]) – A function which is called every time a file has left the set of watched files; this is called with a filename argument.
  • interval (float) – The timeout in seconds when waiting for new messages before handling possible interruption.
  • ctx (Optional[zmq.Context]) – An existing ZeroMQ context to use for the IO work. If None uses the default singleton instance.
